00058 /* When installed into the protocol stream, the Test_Reader's recv()
00059    method will be called when data is ready for processing.
00060  */
00061 int
00062 Test_Reader::recv(ACE_Message_Block * message,
00063                   ACE_Time_Value *timeout )
00064 {
00065     // Announce the request we got from the client
00066 //  ACE_DEBUG ((LM_INFO, "(%P|%t) Test_Reader::recv() length (%d)\n",
00067 //                          message->length() ));
00068 
00069     Packet *packet = (Packet*) message->data_block();
00070 //  packet->dump();
00071 
00072     if (packet->dwOpCode() != 0x5900)
00073     {
00074         ACE_DEBUG ((LM_DEBUG, "(%P|%t) Non-version request packet.  Dropping.\n"));
00075         message->release();
00076         return 0;
00077     }
00078                                 
00079     // Create a response message to send to the client
00080     Message_Block * response = new Message_Block(   16,
00081                                                                                                 packet->dwOpCode(),
00082                                                                                                 ((Message_Block*)message)->peer());
00083 
00084     
00085                                                                                                 
00086     ACE_OS::sprintf( response->wr_ptr(), "2-24-2001 13:17" );
00087     response->wr_ptr( strlen(response->rd_ptr())+1 );
00088         
00089 /*  Packet *rsp_packet = (Packet*) response->data_block();
00090     rsp_packet->dwOpCode( packet->dwOpCode() );
00091     rsp_packet->ARSP(1);
00092     rsp_packet->dwARSP( packet->dwARQ() );
00093     rsp_packet->ARQ(1);
00094     rsp_packet->dwARQ( 0x4ef5 );
00095     rsp_packet->ASQ(1);
00096     rsp_packet->dbASQ_high( 1 );
00097     rsp_packet->SEQStart(1);
00098     rsp_packet->dwSEQ( packet->dwSEQ() );*/
00099 
00100 //  ACE_DEBUG((LM_DEBUG, "(%P|%t) Response: %s\n", response->rd_ptr() ));
00101     
00102     // Release the original message block now that we're through
00103     // "processing" it.
00104     message->release();
00105 
00106 //  rsp_packet->dump();
00107     
00108     // Turn the message around and send it back down the Stream.
00109     // In other words, we invoke the put() method on the
00110     // Protocol_Stream without having to have a direct reference
00111     // to the stream object.
00112     return this->reply( response, timeout );
00113 }
00114
